alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 11:27AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington affecting all of the counties bordering the Mississippi River. .Melted snowpack and rainfall in the upper Midwest will continue to increase river flows downstream on the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Muscatine. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Riverside Park is entirely under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 21.1 feet early Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued this evening.
